title: Cash for Local Crops
desc:
Imagine if every single individual in the country received $150 / month to spend only on locally grown groceries. That would cost and invest ~$650 billion dollars into the healthiest sector of our economy. 

For some context, in 2020 the SNAP (ebt) program distributed $150 / month to ~40 million people (12% of the population) totaling ~$75 billion. Only .05% is spent at farmers markets (see usda.gov links below).

I want to develop a food credits system for subsidizing locally grown food, especially in communities where their most common options are McDonalds and liquor stores. 

This is an invitation to share your insights, experience or ideas, and help bring this to life.
